items.title: Add Support for Uploading Minecraft Maps

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

items.body:
### Please confirm the following.

- [x] I checked the [existing issues](https://github.com/modrinth/code/issues?q=is%3Aissue) for duplicate feature requests
- [x] I have checked that this feature request is not on our [roadmap](https://roadmap.modrinth.com)

### What parts of Modrinth is your feature request related too?

Modrinth App, Modrinth.com website

### Is your suggested feature related to a problem? Please describe.

I would like to suggest adding native support for uploading **Minecraft maps** to Modrinth.

Currently, Modrinth supports mods, resource packs, shaders, and modpacks, but map creators do not have a dedicated project type. Adding map support would allow developers to distribute adventure, survival, parkour, and other custom maps directly on the platform.

### Benefits
- Provides a first-class place for map developers to publish their work  
- Centralises map downloads on Modrinth instead of external file hosts linked in a description
- Enables proper versioning, changelogs, and update management (some resource packs are made specifically for maps, so there is a slight disconnect)
- Allows tagging, categorization, and Minecraft version compatibility  
- Improves discoverability for players  

### Suggested Implementation
- Introduce a new **Map** project type (right now we have *mods, resource packs, shaders, and modpacks*)
- Support `.zip` world uploads  
- Include required fields such as:
  - Minecraft version(s)
  - Map category/type
  - Singleplayer / Multiplayer compatibility (adventure maps for example)
- Optional linking of required resource packs or data packs  

Adding map support would help make Modrinth a more complete platform for Minecraft creators and players alike.
